intro: Dichapetalum sapinii, commonly known as the Alpine dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in rocky or forested habitats at high altitudes. The plant features simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. It is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine or subalpine zones. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
